pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the map obtained between directsums by giving the component-wise mapping. More specifically, it creates a homomorphism `DirectSum.map f : (⨁ i, α i) →+ ⨁ i, β i` from the component-wise map `f : ∀(i : ι), α i →+ β i`. We also proved some basic properties of this function. This construction is expected to be used in things related to graded rings.

#22279 depends on this PR.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [85d3857e00](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22354/commits/85d3857e003afc0c1ed855d18132aba8d3ce226c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ addHom`
`+ addHom_apply`
`+ addHom_comp`
`+ addHom_eq_iff`
`+ addHom_id`
`+ addHom_of`
`+ addHom_surjective`
`+ linearMap`
`+ linearMap_apply`
`+ linearMap_comp`
`+ linearMap_eq_iff`
`+ linearMap_id`
`+ linearMap_of`
`+ linearMap_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
I've updated the linearMap version by now, and the definitions are renamed similarly to those appearing in `DFinsupp` section (so that it's probably easier to find?).

> and the definitions are renamed similarly to those appearing in `DFinsupp` section (so that it's probably easier to find?).

I think `map` is a better name; one of the key differences between `DFinsupp` and `DirectSum` is the deliberate choice to use different terminology (eg `of` vs `single`).

Perhaps `map` and `lmap`  would be reasonable names?
OK, that makes sense as well.
Thanks! There are a few minor issues described below. Mainly just showing you the way we do things in Mathlib.
Thanks! There are a few minor issues described below. Mainly just showing you the way we do things in Mathlib.

I think slightly better as
```suggestion
  DFinsupp.mapRange.linearMap f
```
Notably this removes the need for the `DecidableEq` arguments.

presumably Eric meant:
```suggestion
  DFinsupp.mapRange.addMonoidHom f
```
in which case the proof of `map_of` can be fixed with:
```lean
  show DFinsupp.mapRange.addMonoidHom f (DFinsupp.single i x) = DFinsupp.single i (f i x) 
  simp
```

There should be a single lemma you can invoke for that too.

This of course raises the question of whether we want a linearMap-valued `map` in addition to the `AddMonoidHom`-valued one.

I've already updated the code by now according to your suggestions, and I think we'll be using the linearMap version when we want to construct maps between `GradedAlgebra`. So I'm now trying to add that version as well.

This is what the `congr()` term elaborator is useful for.
```suggestion
    simpa using congr($(h) i)
```
Thanks for the suggestion! I never realized there's such a term elaborator before!

I realize this is longer, but I think it better reflects Mathlib style. We generally avoid putting several tactics on one line, even if they manage to fit. Sometimes people do two, but almost never 3 or 4. Also, it's nice to use the `induction` tactic, and the `rfl` in the `obtain` / `rcases` pattern syntax.
```suggestion
  induction x using DirectSum.induction_on with
  | H_zero => exact ⟨0, by simp⟩
  | H_basic i x =>
    obtain ⟨y, rfl⟩ := h i x
    exact ⟨of α i y, by simp⟩
  | H_plus x y hx hy => 
    obtain ⟨u, rfl⟩ := hx
    obtain ⟨v, rfl⟩ := hy
    exact ⟨u + v, by simp⟩
```

```suggestion
  induction x using DirectSum.induction_on with
  | H_zero => simp
  | H_basic j x =>
    obtain rfl | h := eq_or_ne j i
    · simp
    · simp [of_apply, h]
  | H_plus x y hx hy => simp [hx, hy]
```
Can you prove this about `DFinsupp.mapRange` first?
You're right! I should have done this so that the proofs could be reused.
Indeed we already have `Finsupp.mapRange_surjective`, so that should helpfully also inform what the statement of the `DFinsupp` version should look like.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/DirectSum): getting a map between directsums by giving the map on components
